clinical_study.brief_title: Metabolomics of Liver Regeneration Following Partial Hepatectomy in Healthy Living Liver Donors
clinical_study.official_title: Metabolomics of Liver Regeneration Following Partial Hepatectomy in Healthy Living Liver Donors

brief_summary.textblock: The PI will study metabolism during liver regeneration in living liver donors

detailed_description.textblock: Samples of blood and urine will be collected from study participants at defined timepoints. The samples will be evaluated to study the metabolism of the regenerating liver after a portion of the liver has been donated from a living donor.

primary_outcome.measure: Characterized Metabolic Changes during liver regeneration

biospec_descr.textblock: Each subject will provide samples of urine and blood at specific timepoints as outlined in the protocol

study_pop.textblock: The study population will be comprised of living liver donors.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Potential donor must be in excellent medical and psychological health.
2. Potential donor must be between the ages of 18 and 60.
3. Must have a compatible blood type to the recipient.
4. Must have health care coverage for non-donor related health issues that arise post donation
5. Recipient and donor must have compatible body size.
6. Donors Body Mass Index (BMI) must be less than 30.
7. All previous donor abdominal surgeries will be reviewed on a case by case basis by the surgeon.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Positive blood test for Human Immunodeficiency Virus, Hepatitis C virus, Hepatitis B virus
2. The size of the donor liver is not large enough to safely resection and still retain enough volume to function normally after the surgery.
3. Liver biopsy show liver cirrhosis or early stages of HCC.
